discussion.content: Correct answer A

Selected Answer: A
A is correct; C is not. C needs the details keyword to show the output that is visualized

Selected Answer: A
Tested in my lab.

A. This is the correct answer. Output looks the same on my 3650.
B. show authentication registrations = Shows clients registered with Session Manager
C. show authentication interface ? = Invalid syntax ?
D. show authentication sessions method = Incomplete Command

Selected Answer: A
No need to think, log in to a switch a check the command!

A, the [details] keyword displays multiline results.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/security/s1/sec-s1-xe-3se-3850-cr-book/sec-s1-xe-3se-3850-cr-book_chapter_01.html#wp3404908137

A is correct answer. Below is the command with all of its optional syntax. You can see that mac address is optional syntax

show authentication sessions [ handle handle-number | interface type number | mac mac-address | method method-name interface type number | session-id session-id ]

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/security/s1/sec-s1-xe-3se-3850-cr-book/sec-s1-xe-3se-3850-cr-book_chapter_01.html#wp3404908137

A is the correct answer (it is a valid command)
C would have been a correct answer as well but it is missing the (session) keyword, hence wrong command.

C is the correct answer.
show authentication session : Gives output of all authenticated devices. Not the output shown in question.
show authentication registration : Shows auth methods registered with auth manager.
The output shown is from show authentication interface command.
Reference : https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/security/s1/sec-s1-xe-3se-3850-cr-book/sec-s1-xe-3se-3850-cr-book_chapter_01.html
I think D is the correct answer

C is the Correct answer
show authentication interface gigabitethernet2/0/36
cause the other commands are wrong or they produce different and incomplete output

comments.content: show authentication sessions mac H.H.H details is a valid command

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which command is typed within the CLI of a switch to view the troubleshooting output?

A network engineer must define a Redirect ACL on a Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. The ACL must force unknown users to authenticate via a captive portal located on a Cisco ISE PSN on another network segment separated by a firewall. Which port must be permitted in the firewall to allow traffic between the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller and Cisco ISE?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct Answer is A.
PSN ------------------- ASA---------------------WLC
 RADIUS UDP 1812
PSN---------------------ASA---------------------Guest VLAN
 TCP 8443

The communication between ISE and the WLC is via RADIUS, so UDP port 1812 must be opened.
TCP 8443 is the default port used by the guest portals, but this port must be opened between ISE and the Guest Vlan, so the guest-users are able to reach ISE on port 8443/guest portal.

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B

You create a new porfiling condition matching the MAC address of the IOT device

Radius_Called_Station-ID_ENDSWITH_: This attribute is related to RADIUS authentication and the device that the user is connecting to (e.g., the switch port, SSID). It's not directly related to the endpoint's MAC address.

questions.question_text: An administrator is deploying IOT connector with MAC address 11:22 33:44:55:AA that requires network access. New custom profiling policy must be configured in Cisco ISE in order to properly profile the connector. Which condition must be configured to meet the requirement?
Which two VMware features are supported on a Cisco ISE virtual appliance? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Cisco ISE supports the VMware cold migration feature that allows you to migrate virtual machine (VM) instances (running any persona) between hosts. For the cold migration feature to be functional, the following condition must be met:

 Cisco ISE must be shutdown and powered off: Cisco ISE does not allow to stop or pause the database operations during migration. This might lead to data corruption issues. Hence, ensure that Cisco ISE is not running and active during the migration.

Deploying Cisco ISE virtual appliances using the OVF templates ensures that adequate resources are assigned to each VM. If you do not use OVF templates, then ensure that you assign the equivalent resource reservations when you manually install Cisco ISE using the ISO image. 

 Cisco ISE VM does not support hot migration (vMotion).

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/3-0/install_guide/b_ise_InstallationGuide30/b_ise_InstallationGuide30_chapter_2.html

questions.question_text: What gives Cisco ISE an option to scan endpoints for vulnerabilities?

discussion.content:
my choice is B
The authorization profile in Cisco ISE now includes an option to scan endpoints for vulnerabilities. (Cisco Identity Services Engine Administrator Guide, Release 2.7)
this Q came out in my exam today.

Selected Answer: B
B-authorization profile-- agreed this is where the option is configured

Selected Answer: B
authorization profile

The authorization profile in Cisco ISE now includes an option to scan endpoints for vulnerabilities. You can choose to run the scan periodically and also specify the time interval for these scans. After you define the authorization profile, you can apply it to an existing authorization policy rule or create a new authorization policy rule.
Authorization Policy calls the selected authorization profile. The latter does the endpoint scanning. Correct answer is B.

Answer B is the correcet answer for sure ... you can see the option clearly in Authorization profile tab :
Authorization Profile
* Name 

Description 
* Access Type 
 

Network Device Profile 
 
 
Service Template 
Track Movement 
Passive Identity Tracking 

DACL Name 
ACL (Filter-ID) 
Security Group 
VLAN 
Voice Domain Permission 
Web Redirection (CWA, MDM, NSP, CPP) 
 
Display Certificates Renewal Message
Static IP/Host name/FQDN 
Suppress Profiler CoA for endpoints in Logical Profile 
Auto Smart Port 

[Assess Vulnerabilities
 Adapter Instance 
 
 Trigger scan if the time since last scan is greater than 

Enter value in hours (1-9999)
 Assess periodically using above interval]

Selected Answer: B
The authorization profile in Cisco ISE now includes an option to scan endpoints for vulnerabilities. You can choose to run the scan periodically and also specify the time interval for these scans. After you define the authorization profile, you can apply it to an existing authorization policy rule or create a new authorization policy rule.

Selected Answer: B
It's a Common Task in the Authorization Profile. The Authorization Policy is where you call out the Authorization Profile.

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D
The authorization policy is where you determine flags for endpoint vulnerabilities, profiles only compile the endpoint specific data in the identity store. The auth policy directly scans and "advises" the PAN of any potential vulnerabilities.

B is correct answer

Configure Authorization Profile
The authorization profile in Cisco ISE now includes an option to scan endpoints for vulnerabilities. You can choose to run the scan periodically and also specify the time interval for these scans. After you define the authorization profile, you can apply it to an existing authorization policy rule or create a new authorization policy rule.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/ise/2-2/admin_guide/b_ise_admin_guide_22/b_ise_admin_guide_22_chapter_010100.html

comments.content: I was incorrect, there is an Assess Vulnerabilities option in the profile to do TC-NAC for endpoints.

discussion.content: Looking in my lab, I think the answer should actually be Authorization Policy as you build out the values in the policy / conditions studio. The authorization profile doesn't make any reference to assessing vulnerabilities. Anyone else thinking the same?
